vault_associate_003.question: When Vault is sealed, it can access the physical storage but cannot read the data because it does not know how to decrypt them.
Batch tokens can be renewed indefinitely.
To seal a Vault, the client token must have the sudo capability on the sys/seal path.
Which statement is true about an orphan token?
options: It does not expire when its parent does
It does not have a max time-to-live (TTL)
vault_associate_003.correct_answer: It does not expire when its parent does

vault_associate_003.question: Which path will this policy allow? path "kv/+/team_*"
An organization needs to protect sensitive application data currently stored in a database as plaintext. Which secrets engine provides a solution?
Which command will retrieve all enabled secrets engines?
You need to edit a policy, but the UI doesn't show the Policies item in the nav bar. What is the problem?
options: This is a UI error. Contact support.
You don't have permission to manage policies.
Vault UI does not support policy creation and management.
Use the command shell in UI to manage policies.
vault_associate_003.correct_answer: You don't have permission to manage policies.

vault_associate_003.question: Based on the token lookup output showing type batch, what type of token is it?
Based on the token lookup output showing num_uses 1, how many times can the token be used?
options: The token has expired because max TTL is already at 0s
This token does not expire because the default policy is attached

vault_associate_003.question: What is true of Vault tokens? (Select 2)
options: Vault tokens are generated by every authentication method login
Vault tokens are also known as unseal keys
Vault tokens are required for every Vault call
Vault token IDs always begin with s.
Vault tokens are the core method for authentication in Vault
correct_answers: Vault tokens are generated by every authentication method login
Vault tokens are the core method for authentication in Vault

vault_associate_003.question: Which statements correctly describe vault write transit/decrypt/password ciphertext=...? (Select 2)
options: Returns an error due to missing encryption key name
Decrypts the ciphertext if the token permits
Requires sudo capability on the transit/decrypt/password path
correct_answers: Decrypts the ciphertext if the token permits

vault_associate_003.question: Which of the following statements explains the benefit of response wrapping? (Select 2)
options: Limits the time of secret exposure by having a short-lived wrapping token
It protects Vault's root key (previously known as master key)
Only the reference to the secrets is transmitted over the public network
Limits the size of secrets to be transmitted over the network
correct_answers: Limits the time of secret exposure by having a short-lived wrapping token
Only the reference to the secrets is transmitted over the public network

vault_associate_003.question: Your organization has recently adopted Vault open source. You have been asked to enable the Vault K/V Version 2 secrets engine by two different teams. Company policy states the teams cannot share the same secrets engine. What are two possible solutions? (Select 2)
options: Enable the secrets engine at a dedicated path for each team using the -path parameter
Create a namespace for each of the teams and enable the secrets engine in the teams namespace
Only one type of secrets engine can be enabled on a Vault cluster
Deploy a second Vault cluster, one for each team
Enable the secrets engine at the default path and create policies that limit what each team can access
correct_answers: Enable the secrets engine at a dedicated path for each team using the -path parameter
Deploy a second Vault cluster, one for each team

consul_associate_003.question: When starting the Consul agent with the consul agent -dev command, all core security features will be initialized with the agent.
Individual agents are responsible for defining and monitoring their own services.
Access Control Lists (ACLs) are used to secure access to the UI, API, CLI, service communications, and agent communications.
Which protocol(s) need to be enabled in your network configuration to permit the nodes to communicate over the gossip protocol?
What is being indicated by a health check error in the Consul UI for a Dashboard service?
options: The node hosting the Dashboard service is down
The proxy in the service mesh has failed
The dashboard service failed to register
One or more health checks for the Dashboard service have failed
consul_associate_003.correct_answer: One or more health checks for the Dashboard service have failed

consul_associate_003.question: With an intention rule showing web -> api, what will be the behavior of that service communication?
options: All service to service communication will be denied
The web service will be allowed to communicate with the api service
Communication cannot occur until an api -> web rule is created
The api service will be able to send traffic to web
consul_associate_003.correct_answer: The web service will be allowed to communicate with the api service

consul_associate_003.question: What are the benefits of using the Consul Enterprise feature of adding read replicas in a redundancy zone to your Consul datacenter? (Select 2)

terraform_associate_003.question: Usernames and passwords referenced in the Terraform code, even as variables, will end up in plain text in the state file.
Given a map variable vpc_cidrs with keys for different AWS regions, how would you reference the CIDR block for us-east-1 in an aws_vpc resource?
You've defined variable values in terraform.tfvars in your configuration directory. Which command(s) will use those values when generating an execution plan?
Which Terraform commands automatically refresh the state unless additional flags are supplied? (Select 2)
What occurs when applying Terraform configuration? (Select 2)
options: Terraform makes any infrastructure changes defined in configuration
Terraform retrieves plugins the configuration requires
Terraform updates the state file with configuration changes it made
Terraform corrects formatting errors in configuration
Terraform destroys and recreates all infrastructure from scratch
correct_answers: Terraform makes any infrastructure changes defined in configuration
Terraform updates the state file with configuration changes it made
